div.p: Greetings. I am brief, because our Lord Lysman here will be in place of a very long letter. Nor is there a need for me to commend him to you, whom I understand to be very dear to you otherwise. He is of sound judgment: confirm him in sound doctrine and encourage him to offer his efforts to his fellow Poles. He will report more and certain things about Polish affairs.
Farewell, my most esteemed lord and brother, and never allow yourself to think that I love Calvin any less. ZÃ¼rich, December 4, 1555.
To the most illustrious man, Lord Johannes Calvin, most faithful pastor of the church of Geneva, my most esteemed brother.
